title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for calculating the correct required reserve ratio of 0.2.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for calculating the correct required reserve ratio of 0.2.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for calculating the correct required reserve ratio of 0.2.

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the excess reserves will increase by $5,000.

  • One point is earned for stating that the change in demand deposits is zero.
descriptions:
No points earned.

  • One point is earned for stating that the excess reserves will increase by $5,000.

  • One point is earned for stating that the change in demand deposits is zero.

Earns 1 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for stating that the excess reserves will increase by $5,000.

  • One point is earned for stating that the change in demand deposits is zero.

Earns 2 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for stating that the excess reserves will increase by $5,000.

  • One point is earned for stating that the change in demand deposits is zero.

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for calculating the increase in the money supply and for showing correct work: 5 × $5,000 = $25,000.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for calculating the increase in the money supply and for showing correct work: 5 × $5,000 = $25,000.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for calculating the increase in the money supply and for showing correct work: 5 × $5,000 = $25,000.

title: Part d.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that the price of bonds will increase because the purchase of bonds increases the money supply, which decreases the interest rate.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that the price of bonds will increase because the purchase of bonds increases the money supply, which decreases the interest rate.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for stating that the price of bonds will increase because the purchase of bonds increases the money supply, which decreases the interest rate.

title: Part e.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that the cash deposit will not immediately change the money supply.
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that the cash deposit will not immediately change the money supply.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for stating that the cash deposit will not immediately change the money supply.
